CommonFields.Title: Epoxy/graphene platelets nanocomposites with two levels of interface strength
Author: Zaman, Izzuddin
Phan, Tam Thanh
Kuan, Hsu-Chiang
Meng, Qingshi
Bao La, Ly Truc
Luong, Lee
Youssf, Osama
Ma, Jun
CommonFields.Location: School of Advanced Manufacturing & Mechanical Engineering, University of South Australia, Mawson Lakes, SA 5095, Australia

Matrix.Description: The matrix used was an epoxy resin with epoxide equivalent weight 182-196 g/equiv

ChooseParameter.Other: 4g of graphite was pestled in a mortar

Mixing.Description: The container with the graphite and acetone mixture was covered and sonicated.

ChooseParameter.Other: the suspension was moved to a glass beaker 1 min after sonication
the beaker was covered and stored at rt for 2 hours

Drying-Evaporation.Description: The precipitate remaining was collected and dried.

Filler.Description: graphene platelets were formed by sonication of acid-treated graphite

ChooseParameter.Other: GP was suspended in THF using a metal container

Mixing.Description: The container was closed and the mixture was sonicated at a temperature below 30 C.

ChooseParameter.Other: The suspension was then transferred to a roundbottom flask equipped with a condenser

Additive.Description: MDI was dropped into the suspension 3 mins into mixing

Mixing.Description: The mixture was mixed with a magnetic stirrer.
The acetone was evaporated by mixing
Temperature was controlled as J230 was added to mixture in order to avoid premature curing

ChooseParameter.Other: mixture was degassed in a vacuum oven to remove bubbles
The mixture was poured into a rubber mould to prepare for the curing process

Heating.Description: Curing began by heating mixture to 80 C for 0.5 hrs and held at that temperature for 2.5 hrs.
Subsequently the mixture was heated to 120 C for 0.5 hrs and held for 12 hrs

AcceleratingVoltage.description: a Philips CM200 transmission electron microscope

Dynamic_Mechanical_Analysis.Equipment: DMA 2980 Dynamic Mechanical Analyser (TA Instruments, Inc., USA)

Fourier_Transform_Infrared_Spectroscopy.Equipment: Nicolet Avatar 320 Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
